Here is the caller graph for this function:

static void Matrix4fSetRotationFromMatrix3f ( Matrix4fT^   NewObj,
Matrix3fT^   m1 
) [inline, static]

Sets the rotational component (upper 3x3) of this matrix to the matrix values in the T precision Matrix3d argument; the other elements of this matrix are unchanged; a singular value decomposition is performed on this object's upper 3x3 matrix to factor out the scale, then this object's upper 3x3 matrix components are replaced by the passed rotation components, and then the scale is reapplied to the rotational component

Parameters:
NewObj This matrix.
m1 T precision 3x3 matrix

Here is the caller graph for this function:

static GLfloat Matrix4fSVD ( Matrix4fT^   NewObj,
Matrix3fT^   rot3,
Matrix4fT^   rot4 
) [inline, static]

Performs SVD on this matrix and gets scale and rotation. Rotation is placed into rot3, and rot4.

Parameters:
NewObj This matrix.
rot3 the rotation factor(Matrix3d). if null, ignored
rot4 the rotation factor(Matrix4) only upper 3x3 elements are changed. if null, ignored
Returns:
scale factor

this is a simple svd. Not complete but fast and reasonable. See comment in Matrix3d.
